data.title: Geneva College Higher Education Partnership
data.meta_description: Learn about the partnership between Geneva College’s M.A. in Higher Education program and Bethel University’s Ed.D. Leadership in Higher Education program.
data.text:
Bethel University has partnered with Geneva College to give you additional course options and a scholarship opportunity when you’re accepted into our Ed.D. in Leadership in Higher Education program.

What Our Partnership Means to You

As a graduate of Geneva College’s M.A. in Higher Education program, Bethel University will:

Offer you a University Partnership Scholarship when you meet scholarship requirements: You could receive up to $400 per semester (maximum $1,200 per year). The scholarship is not based on financial need.

Waive up to 2 required courses: Depending on the courses you completed at Geneva College, Bethel Ed.D. faculty will provide you with additional course options as replacements for the waived courses, helping you tailor your program to best meet your goals.

University Partnership Scholarship Requirements

To be eligible for a scholarship you must:

Be accepted into Bethel’s Ed.D. in Leadership in Higher Education program

Enroll in at least 3 program credits per semester

Bethel’s Ed.D. in Leadership in Higher Education program trains educators to become transformational leaders who are ready to tackle present challenges while preparing for the future of higher education.

Learn more about our program today.
